summary: States and school districts can compete for Department of Education grants. Applicants may increase their chances of success by addressing certain priorities. This Q&A covers these priorities, which officials said come from Education's general authority or from laws and regulations. Addressing overarching priorities can give applicants an edge in many grants. Since 2001, Education has published these 15 times. The most recent are from 2021...
title: K-12 Education: Education’s Priorities in Discretionary Grantmaking
topics: Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics education
